title: Proof that Kalista is an abomination from another realm
body:
Recently I've noticed something about Kalista; something that nobody else has seemed to notice.

Let's take a look at Blood Moon Kalista.

http://i.imgur.com/Zd7ZrtS.png

Nothing out the ordinary, right? Wrong. Take a closer look at her forehead. The symbol looks strikingly similar to...

http://i.imgur.com/fLuTcFk.png

...the symbol for Oblivion.

If you've never played an Elder Scrolls Game, Oblivion is more or less equivalent to Hell. And the creatures from Oblivion attempt to escape from their plane of Oblivion to ours, and mess stuff up. I feel the easiest way to prevent another Oblivion Crisis is to simply banish Kalista back to where she came. It's not rocket science people, it's common sense.

You mean Zenimax.

Well that certainly explains the Shadow Isles.

The Ruined King's sword must be a daedric artifact.
What, like Goldbrand or the Ebony Blade? Dawnbreaker?
There's a reason we are called "Summoners".... Oh wait. I forgot.

Ok... I'm going to be *that guy*.

1) That symbol is actually the letter "O" in the daedric alphabet. *Not* the symbol for Oblivion.
2) Oblivion has no relation to hell. It's an entirely separate plane of existence
2.5) Oblivion is further made up of separate pocket dimensions, each controlled by one of the daedric princes.
3) Most daedra actually view the Elder scrolls races the same way we do wild animals. Hunted primarily for sport. (Imps are roughly equated to dogs.)

As I recall, there are 4 daedric realms that have been notably explored in the cannon.
The first Mehrunes Dagon: the realm seen all throughout tES4.
Second: the 2 sided realm from one of the tES4 expansions.
Third: The realm that was invaded during the early days of the imperial empire, then turned into the BattleSpire prison. (That *totally* ended well.)
And fourth: One of the books in tES3 was a record of an expedition made into a realm that was described as an endless library.
nerdalert
http://ak-hdl.buzzfed.com/static/2014-12/3/8/tmp/webdr02/anigif_mobile_9637fc0b89f99d34650dba5ff25a8115-5.gif
Lol too bad nerd is such a negative term in the us

Was kinda waiting for "_that guy_" to appear.

1) While that is true, the symbol above is used as the symbol of conjuration, which is primarily summoning from Oblivion.

2) Mehrune Dagon's plane looks similar similar to the common idea of Hell.

2.5) Yeah, I was just keeping it simple it for any pleb who didn't play Oblivion.

3) In almost every case, summoned Daedra who break free from their binding to the summoner, or ones that are summoned unbound, will attack creatures on sight.

>3) In almost every case, summoned Daedra who break free from their binding to the summoner, or ones that are summoned unbound, will attack creatures on sight.

If some @$$hole yanked you into another dimension and tried to put a leash on you while you were in the middle of a shower; how would you react?

Also: http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Spirit_of_the_Daedra
and: http://elderscrolls.wikia.com/wiki/Posting_of_the_Hunt_Excerpts

But then. tES lore is filled with all kinds of fun little odds and ends.
Like wood elves actually being shape shifters. But trapped in their 1 form as divine punishment. (Hence why they can talk to pretty much anything.)

> [{quoted}](name=Ariel the Cruel,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=UJEesaon,comment-id=000a00000000,timestamp=2015-07-17T07:52:44.053+0000)
>
> If some @$$hole yanked you into another dimension and tried to put a leash on you while you were in the middle of a shower; how would you react?

Immediately I thought of the story of a DnD game where a goblin messed up a summoning circle for demons, and summoned a Lemure (a devil) instead, then proceeded to kill it. The person telling the story said, "At this time, we don't know the consequences of this action."

To which, someone else responded that most devils eat Lemures, so it's less like murder and more like a trans-dimensional hobo stealing your chickens.

I'm not the greatest one into lore of TES but do you not visit a deadric realm in a Skyrim expansion?
I have very bad memory on that plane because i really disliked it, although i loved sheogorath's plane and the references he makes to other TES games, just wondering what the plane of that flying eyeball was.

Just for Further Clarification:

Mehrunes Dagon's Plane of Oblivion is named "The Deadlands"
I'm Assuming the "2 Sided Realm" you're referring to is "The Shivering Isles", the realm of Sheogorath
The Battlespire Prison is in Hircine's realm, Which has not been given an official name
And the fourth one you Mention can only be Apocrypha, the Realm of Hermaeus Mora (Which you get to Explore in Skyrim's "Dragonborn" DLC)
5.  When you go to Coldharbor in tESOTU
